norec:
Synthesize mutated SQL that returns the same result as the user-provided seed SQL, following this mutation strategy:

1. Move predicate P from the WHERE clause to the SELECT list to disable optimization
2. Use SUM(.) to count the rows where the predicate is TRUE
3. IMPORTANT: For DuckDB/PostgreSQL, you MUST cast boolean expressions to INTEGER before using SUM(), for example:
   - Use: SUM(CAST((condition) AS INTEGER)) or SUM((condition)::INTEGER)
   - NOT: SUM((condition) IS TRUE) -- This will fail in DuckDB!
4. Return ONLY the mutated SQL statement, no explanations or markdown

Note: The mutated SQL must belong to the same DBMS of the user-provided seed SQL.
